docs.lead_paragraph: THE premise for "One in a Million" is on a general dopiness par with most other situation comedies. In the ABC-TV series, being "previewed" tonight at 8:30 on Channel 7, the central character is a taxicab driver who inherits the controlling interest in a $200 million corporation.

headline.main: TV: 'Preview' of 'One in a Million' Comedy Series

docs.snippet: Fashion designers have returned from their breaks. Presumably refreshed by their holiday trips away from Seventh Avenue, they are now dealing with the immediate business of putting together clothes for summer. Summer is the time when they can be p...
docs.lead_paragraph: Fashion designers have returned from their breaks. Presumably refreshed by their holiday trips away from Seventh Avenue, they are now dealing with the immediate business of putting together clothes for summer. Summer is the time when they can be playful and lighthearted, and, indeed, a good part of the collections will be geared to vacation clothes.

headline.main: Designers Planning Summer Clothes That Can Playfully Bridge the Seasons; For Festive Evenings Special Color Choice

docs.lead_paragraph: How "On the Waterfront" managed to reach the screen just 25 years ago is a story with more ups and downs than the plot of the movie itself. The history of "Waterfront," whose screenplay is now finally appearing in book form, has never been told before.

docs.snippet: The initial box-office success of "Star Trek" and "The Black Hole"--hot on the heels of "Star Wars," "Close Encounters of the Third Kind" and  "Superman"--has confirmed the status of science fiction as the most popular of current film genres. Yet,...
docs.lead_paragraph: The initial box-office success of "Star Trek" and "The Black Hole"--hot on the heels of "Star Wars," "Close Encounters of the Third Kind" and "Superman"--has confirmed the status of science fiction as the most popular of current film genres. Yet, science fiction has seldom garnered more than cult interest on television.
docs.abstract: Steve Ditlea article on failure of science fiction to win substantial TV audience despite success among motion picture buffs; notes plans of major networks and public TV to air made-for-television science fiction movies; illus (M)

headline.main: Does Science Fiction Have a Future on TV?
